values:
I'm not entirely sure if any one still reads my Livejournal but this is the last place I can think to promote my website.

It's called The Lunch Room and the address is thelunchroom.net. I have a podcast there and a webcomic called A Theatre Near You. The podcast is called The Lunch Table and can also be found on iTunes under the same name.

You can contact us via:

Twitter: thelunchroom
Email: Lunchfansatgmaildotcom

Hope you all check out what we've been working on and I hope you enjoy it if you do.
its been awhile. I'm still alive, still working at the theatre, still making money, still playing videogames, and still chasing girls I can't have. Same old me.

I'd forgotten how exhausting good conversation could be. 

[mcp]
I'm hoping that some how this Fall will be better than last Fall.
Its been 4 years, and there have been others in my life, but none that can wash the slate I scribbled on with you clean to start a new.

So far my 360 has bricked on me (I got red ringed at midnight) and Front Row won't launch on my MacBook. I've called customer support about my 360 and they are sending me out a box to send in my $400 brick so they can make it work again. I CAN'T call Apple support about Front Row, and I CAN'T trouble shoot it myself as I am running a beta build of OS X Leopard and anything I do basically breaks the computer even more. 

So my 360 is dead and my MacBook is a Leper. My iPhone is still wonderful though I am impatiently waiting for the 1.1.1 update thats supposed to be coming, and I bought another ringtone today. That made my day brighter.

Later days

[mcp]

Well I am one step closer to going back to school. I filled out and submitted my FAFSA forms, albeit with the help of my gracious sister. I am also one step closer to losing my head again;-P

Later days

[mcp]

Nothing quite like bombing around dirt roads while belting out 70's and 80's rock songs with a good friend... oh and the no handed driving while busting out the air guitars is just awesome!

Later days

[mcp]

It took a couple days, and a couple stupid situations but I got to the bottom of my problem or problems and I feel much better now.

Later days

[mcp]

Not entirely sure who still reads this, but I'm still alive, so if you read this and you've tried to kill me... you've failed.

Its summer, and being that its 2007 that puts in and odd numbered year. Those are the crazy ones for me I'm starting to think. Even years are nice and easy and... fun, and the odd years are crazy, chaotic and well... fun, but in a different way.

In many ways I'm starting to think I'm like an almanac, looking to the past to try and figure out the future. Some people think that history repeats, others don't. I'm not quite sure what I think yet, but as stated above, my even years are the same and my odd years re the same.

I look to my past to figure out what I should do next based off of the situation I'm in in the present to determine where its going to end up in the future. Thats not saying that I can't improvise, improvising is what I do the most in the odd years, so I think I'm pretty could at it. But I'm calculating and borderline manipulative, though I have yet to meet some one that says its in a bad way, but if you think about it, and I have, can you use the word manipulative in a good way to describe yourself? I submit that you can not, but I still do.

~The past is a tricky thing. It gets us to where we are in the present, and we think we should never look back on it. However if we don't recognize our pasts then we really aren't anything in the present, and we become restricted to what we can be in the future.

-Me, believe it or not:-)

Later days

[mcp]

I have a date friday evening with a girl I've had a crush for a little over a year.

Later days

[MCP]
first livejournal update from my iphone:-)

Just thought I would share.

NEW MAROON 5!!!

The song is Makes Me Wonder. I like it a lot.

Well I moved out of my Grandmothers basement. I am living with my sister (Nicole) in a 2 bedroom apartment in Heatherwood. I like it a lot. The social part withstanding it reminds me of living in the dorms freshman year and in Laker Village. Makes me happy.

I am happy don't get me wrong, good job, good friends, great TV, great computer. I'm just bored. I think its me just settling into my life even further, and I know it will pass, but for right now I'm just really bored. My Wii isn't exciting anymore, just fun (I bowled a 300 yesterday in Wii sports), my 360 is just sitting there. I need new games for each of them, I get Wii Play in like a week though so thats good.

Coaching hockey is going well, thats about the only time I am not bored, lol. Jason, John, and myself are supposed to start playing Exalted here again real soo. Jason up graded Briggam, and I made Ramsus sister Scarlett. This should be fun since I have a first aig airship. Shes really more of a playable NPC, and thats fine by me, I'm a better supporting role player than a leader, unless its Alaric. Any how that starts soon, so that will be new and exciting, and hopefully different from any other campaign I have been apart of.

Okay, so yea, I'm still alive, still don't have a girlfriend, but thats np big deal (though one would be nice).

Any one wants to come hang out with me in my new place is more than welcome, just give me a call or IM me and I'll pass on the directions.

Later Days

[mcp]

I bought a new computer the other day. About 3 years ago I bought my first Mac. It was an iBook and I immediately fell in love with it. I never bought it to replace the Windows machine I had at the time, I just wanted a small portable notebbok computer, and I was ready for something new, so I bought the Mac. I named her Edward after Ed from Cowboy BeBop. Why? Cause it was cute, childish, and had a lot of potential. A lot more than I probably ever used. I broke it (software wise) numerous times, and each time I learned more and more. Last Tuesday was the last day I spent with Edward. I bought a new computer. I went with another Mac as well, I fell in love with OS X. I bought White MacBook. Her name is Sakaki after my Favorite Azumanga Daioh character. More importantly, like Sakaki, the MacBook is considered "cool" but it wants to be "cute". I'll post a review after some use, but so far, HOT DAMN is she fast. Later Days [mcp] *Sakaki is my user icon for this post if you all were curious

I'm trying to fight an emotional relapse. In an effort to get my TiVo hooked to my TV I tore the basement apart looking for a cable splitter, alas I found none, but what I did find that brought my search to a screeching halt was a picture taken of me with Jessica the second weekend we were together, I looked so happy. What the hell happened? I have no idea and I am trying not to relapse and think about it too much. What happened happened and theres nothing I can do about it.

... great picture though.

So I went driving around today, I drove down M-15. For those of you who don't know I spent a couple of years on M-15. Its a stretch of road running from Davison to I-75 (I know it goes farther north, just not for me). I found some places I used to go, places I have been a couple times, and while I could remember going there, and who I was with, and when, I can't remember what I talked about with the people there, I used to think I could, but when I was driving I realized I couldn't, and I also realized there is an ice cream place in Goodrich that I have been to once 4 years ago that I have no idea how to get to. Normally I would have come home and cried and beat the shit out of myself trying to remember, but something was different this time, I coulnd't have cared less. Sure I remember the big things and the big conversations that I have had over the last 7 years, but the little stuff that used to bother me cause I couldn't remember, doesn't. I think this is a good sign that mentally I am ready move forward and to stop trying to stay connected to the past, that my brain is finally cleaning out the closet so I can store new memories.

I've gone ahead and listed them in purchase order. Up until my purchases in 2006 all of them have been on the games release date or with in a week. And thankfully my list makes it easy to show the big time span from 2005 to 2006 I went one year with out purchasing a video game (for my PS2), as you can see from my NHL 06 and 07 purchases. The biggest gap is from my purchase of NHL 2004 to my purchase of Metal Gear Solid 3 some 14 months later.

Yes, I have a Gamecube, maybe you think I bought games for that...

I own 5 games for it

2001:
Smash Brothers**
Pikmin***

2002:
Metroid Prime***

2004:
Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles***
Metroid Prime 2: Echoes*

So no, I wasn't buying games for my Cube, in fact I hardly played it. But I find myself playing more and more games lately, I bought Amplitude and love it, I bought DMC 3 and I am LOVING that, and of course Tiger, which I learned is only fun for me when I play against some one, and jason and I are still enjoying NHL 07, and I have my DS that I play at work. Maybe its that I find myself bored like I am now, but I am not playing games right now, or maybe its cause I am going to purchase a new TV and don't just want to stare at its awesomeness, but want content to play on it. I dunno, but I like that I am playing games again.

*Haven't played it longer than a couple of hours

**Played for more than a couple months and or almost finished

***Either beaten or played through more than one (1) season

Some people believe that God works through the people around us. Do you think you would be able to notice if you were one of the ones that God was working through? Or do you think you would know/realize it after he was done working through you?
At what point does too much coinsidence become more than chance?
I haven't felt this sedated after a telephone call in years.

The other day we (the projectionists) were informed that by the end of November all the projectors would be digital. My job isn't in danger as they will be doing dual operation (Digital and Film projectors side by side) cause the failure rate of DP's is so high. So there are two ways to look at this. One, my job is going to get easier, and two, it's going to get MORE boring.

Just thought I would mention it.

Oh and Since the end of July I have read 3 books, American Psycho, Rules of Attraction, and Less Than Zero. 3 books,in the summer, I MUST be bored.

Later days

[mcp]

Whats gone? I dunno, but it's gone. Most of the time it is my ability to talk to girls. Not that I can't talk to them, its my ability to follow up with a second meaningful conversation, or setting up so I CAN have another conversation with them that eludes me. Jason says its cause I don't want to, and I think he is partially right and partially wrong. I just don't feel like any of the girls I have met since moving back are worth a damn, and I don't feel like settling right now. It's been over a year since I was in a REAL relationship (6 months longer than usual), 8 months since I had a home run, and 2 months since I made it to 3rd base and THAT was a disaster. Now, don't get me wrong, I am NOT complaining about being single, I am complaining about my lack of drive to FIX the "problem". I have stated this before in an earlier entry, so its nothing new. But its got to stop, I have to find myself before I can find some one I know that, and I am closer every day. I have a great job, great friends, and a great family. I am just missing that one last crucial part, but I am really in no hurry to find it.

Later days

[mcp]

Once in a while I do something really stupid that makes my walls come down so I can remind my self that I am in fact still human. I start to think about what I HAD instead of what I HAVE and I end up feeling nauseous, tonight's trigger?

Fucking pictures I can not bring my self to get rid of.

Dammit!

Oh, and Happy Birthday to me, I am 25.

Sometimes, and part of me feels/knows this is wrong, but ...

When I pull in the driveway late at night, sometimes I stand there waiting for you to pull in behind me.

Sometimes

When I leave work and I am driving around I always think of all these things I want to write in my LJ and how to format them so my points get acrossed, but then when I get home I realize just how many people on my friends list will actually give a shit and well, those are the ones that actually know how I feel any ways.

Later days

[mcp]

I almost had the nerve to ask a good lookin 35 year old that was in an accident I witnessed to go get coffee or something on my way home from my parents house.

In hindsight I think I should have done it.

Dammit!

I got my first check today, $259.23 for 25.4 hours worth of work (in one week). 

Now lets compare...

At Cinemark I made about the same when I worked 48.97 hours a week.

Bottom line, I am happy.

But am I really happy? I don't think I have been happy for a VERY long LONG time. Sure I still have fun, but fun and happiness are 2 different things, aren't they? I was talking to Jason the other day about how I was feeling and this is what he said...

"Feeling lonely and no drive to do anything about?"

"Yup."

"Just making sure."

Pitiful I know, but its how I feel, dead inside. Since last Saturday I have managed to get 3 or less hours of sleep a night, even if I force myself to sleep I don't really sleep. But I am fine all day long, I think I'll probably die of exhaustion some day.

On the up side I guess I have got caught up on Rescue Me on FX. I dled seasons 1 and 2 and got caught up on season 3, excellent show. And my dad and I have been watching Saved on TNT, another excellent show. Work is good, the people are nice, but its work, its something to do and the money is good, VERY good obviously.

Anyways, I am off to another sleepless night.

Later days

[mcp]

It's official, there is something wrong with me, I can't sleep, I can't talk to the opposite sex, my sex drive is almost, no wait, it is none existent. I would think I was gay except I have no sexual impulses towards my own sex. I have no driven desire to meet members of the opposite sex, and when I do and we are done talking, I might as well have not talked to them cause I just don't care. It's almost like I need meaningful sustained exposure with a girl, like a date or something or several, nothing intimate or sexual, I mean I like talking to all of you, but fleeting conversation is starting to bore me, and my lack of sex drive annoys me, but then I no longer have a sexual desire towards most women, and if I do? And I blink? Forget about it, might as well not have happened.

Fair warning

I'm an ass hole, and I am lashing out toward the opposite sex in a very sharp to the point sarcastic manner that is almost hurtful, if you're family and female, you're safe, if your potential date material, you're safe, but other than... talk to me at your own risk.

Just a fair warning

later days

[mcp]

I've got more wit, a better kiss, a hotter touch, a better fuck than any boy you'll ever meet, sweetie you had me. Girl I was it, look past the sweat, a better love deserving of exchanging body heat in the passenger seat? No, no, no, you know it will always just be me.

I'm still alive, work is going good, Pirates is great except the end, damn the end. Oh, and I am obsessed with the Boondocks on [as].

Later days

[mcp]

Haven't exactly signed papers yet, but the job is mine.

What job?

Projectionist at Trillium for 13 dollars an hour. Thats right... TWICE what I was making at Cinemark! I am happy to say the least and I should be able to pull in atleast 30 hours a week.

Saw Superman last night and seeing it again tonight, its good, but not better thatn Batman Begins, but then what is? The kid is kinda like Katie Holmes in BB, it would have been better with out it.

Yea, I am still alive. I am working a little, and I spend a lot of time at the Beanery playing people online in Tetris, but I am still alive.

Just thought I would let you all know!

Later days

[mcp]

Just want everyone to know that I am infact alive and well living in Grand Blanc again. I moved back cause it dawned on me I had been doing the wrong thing for about 6 months and I had had enough of it so I just moved.

Later days

Okay, I have to Zippo lighters. One I got from my dad in the Spring of 2004, it's stainless steel and very cool, no fancy graphics on. The second Zippo is the same thing, I just found it at work while cleaning theatres last summer, or something. I can't really remember. So I have 2 lighters, but I can only find one. While on my quest to find the second lighter I went to the drunk of my car. Heres what I found... My picture holder from my old wallet which had Lauren's, Jessica's, and my cousin Jessica's senior pictures in it. Yet another thing I thought I had lost. They are now in my current wallet as best they can be. I found some more poster putty for when I hang my posters. Whats funny about this though, is that I don't remember when I got this poster putty or when I used it last. And the last thing I found, the thing I thought I would NEVER find in the trunk of my car... a power cord for my SNES. I tore my Gmas basement apart looking for it, I went to some videogame retail shops looking to buy a new one, I even went so far as to look on eBay for prices for a potential new one. But alas, no money spent cause I went to my CAR looking for my second lighter! Thus, I am really happy. Chrono Trigger the way it was ment to be played, as well as Secret of Mana! Okay, guess its not that exciting, just thought I would let you all know. [mcp]

Okay, kind of a really entry cause I have nothing better to do...

So I have moved, I am now in downtown Grand Rapids instead of Allendale. I like it better, but I think thats cause it feels more like Grand Blanc/Flint. I live with Kelley and Carol from work and there friend Carl. They don't seem to get along with him to well, and I didn't think i would either, but I should have learned my lesson in 2002. I had 3 roommates my freshman year and thought I would get along with one of them and not the other. Well I ended up getting along with the one I thought I wouldn't better than the one I thought I would get along with. Did you get that? Good... moving on

Still working at the theatre, still a projectionist. Got a 5 cent raise today (don't you all cheer at once). Still don't make a lot, but I get a lot of hours, so if I can balance my social life with work... I will be okay I think. I remember when it used to be balancing work around a social life and not balancing a social life around work. I miss those days, it seems like so long ago to the days of 99 cent gas, sex, and running around till all hours of the night. Now gas is $2.80, I've been on a dry spell for almost 6 months, and well, I guess I am still up till all hours of the night whether I am on my computer or out with the few friends that can have with the life style I have choosen,

Last night, in sheer unadulterated curiosity I made a list. A list of what you might ask... well I'll put the data in this entry and you see if you can guess what it is. Here you go...

Total=17
1=16
2=12
3=7
H=3

A cookie to any one how can figure it out. The clues are in the data;-)

I bought candles today. I have light in my room and I don't like leaving it on all night just so I can use my computer, and the strain of the light from my notebook was starting to get to me, plus I know one light source is bad. So I went to the Yankee Candle shop at the mall before work. They had these little scented candles, 12 for 12 dollars. I got 12 and 2 holders. I have burned through one already, almost. I might have to invest in different candle holders. As for scents, you better believe I got strawberry (very relaxing), but I didn't just get 12 of those. Lets see, what else did I get... Juicy Cherry, Macintosh and Peach, Clean Cotton, and Splash of Rain. So here I sit, probably the most relaxed I have been in months, smells of strawberry taking me back to simpler time. 

Bliss...

I miss those day.

Any way, there is other things going on, plotting, and conspiracies and what not.

Later days

[mcp]

How To Save A Life Lyrics


Step one you say we need to talk
He walks you say sit down it's just a talk
He smiles politely back at you
You stare politely right on through
Some sort of window to your right
As he goes left and you stay right
Between the lines of fear and blame
And you begin to wonder why you came

Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend
Somewhere along in the bitterness
And I would have stayed up with you all night
Had I known how to save a life

Let him know that you know best
Cause after all you do know best
Try to slip past his defense
Without granting innocence
Lay down a list of what is wrong
The things you've told him all along
And pray to God he hears you

Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend
Somewhere along in the bitterness
And I would have stayed up with you all night
Had I known how to save a life

As he begins to raise his voice
You lower yours and grant him one last choice
Drive until you lose the road
Or break with the ones you've followed
He will do one of two things 
He will admit to everything
Or he'll say he's just not the same
And you'll begin to wonder why you came

Where did I go wrong, I lost a friend
Somewhere along in the bitterness
And I would have stayed up with you all night
Had I known how to save a life
I am so conflicted with what to do with you right now...

Something happened a month ago. I went to bed one night feeling like shit, and then I awoke the next day feeling better than I have in YEARS. It's been almost 3, maybe 4 years since I have felt THIS good. I guess meeting new people will do that to you, since I haven't met any one new in that span of time. But also, I feel more comfortable with my self, like I have two sides again instead of just one. I have the one that everyone sees and one that only a few of my friends and my significant other sees. I like when I am like this cause I am not as vulnerable, or rather I don't feel as vulnerable in public situations any more. I am speaking my mind first a fixing things later, and it seems to be working, and I am having a blast with my life right now. I don't think I have ever been funnier in my life, and you know what... I don't care if people are laughing at me or with me as long as they are laughing. My improve skillz are coming back (yes I used a "z" back there) and they are coming back sharper than ever, not to mention my subtle ability to manipulate truths is also coming back as well (dance puppets dance).

Maybe it's the fact that its been almost 6 months or maybe its just the fact that I am meeting new people, or that my job is going a little better now, I dunno, but I like who I am, and I am enjoying all the fun I am having.

[mcp]
